definition: unprecedented/never seen before
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
not yet/did not/have not/not/8th earthly branch: 1-3 p.m., 6th solar month (7th July-6th August), year of the Sheep/ancient Chinese compass point: 210°
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Gauguin's style in art was like nothing Van Gogh had ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 高更的藝術風格是梵高前所未見的。
這個案件前所未見“他說。

sentences.english: He drew out his pencil, and produced on the spot one of the most ludicrous figures that ever was seen.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起他的鉛筆，畫下這前所未見最可笑的畫面。

sentences.english: The show included the presentation of several previously unseen air-launched tactical systems.
sentences.chinese: 這次展覽包括幾個前所未見的空射型戰術系統的代表。

sentences.english: I led my country to the greatest prosperity that it has seen.
sentences.chinese: 朕將國家治理爲前所未見的太平盛世。

definition: could happen at any moment/on the verge

to try hard to/to strive to

pioneering work
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
inspiring/exciting/rousing
career

social media (Tw)
